content:
Ateli

Ateli is a small town and a municipal committee near Narnaul in Mahendragarh district in the north Indian state of Haryana.{"citetype": "web", "url": "http://www.censusindia.gov.in/pca/SearchDetails.aspx?Id=70395", "title": "Ateli (MC)", "website": "[[2011 Census of India]]", "publisher": "[[Government of India]]", "accessdate": "19 September 2017", "urlstatus": "live", "archiveurl": "https://archive.today/20170919142012/http://www.censusindia.gov.in/pca/SearchDetails.aspx?Id=70395", "archivedate": "19 September 2017"}

Geography
Ateli has an average elevation of 299 m (980 feet).

Demographics
As of 2011[update] India census, Ateli had a population of 8678. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Ateli has an average literacy rate of 78%, higher than the national average of 59.5%; with 58% of the males and 42% of females being literate. Thirteen percent of the population is under six years of age. Good well settle area.
Descent people.

Railways
Ateli railway station lies on the Rewari-Narnaul route. Only slow passenger trains & Chetak Express (12982)stop here.

Roads
Rewari-Narnaul highway was a state highway, SH 26, and has been made a national highway, NH 11. The highway is being widened to four lanes. The NH connects Rewari to Ateli, Narnaul, Jhunjhunu and Bikaner.
Transportation facility is very very good to Narnaul, Rewari, Gurgaon & Delhi.

Politics
The current state MLA of Ateli is Sitaram Yadav of BJP.
